argument.name: form_id
argument.description: The ID of the form to submit.

argument.name: keepOldValues
argument.description: Indicates whether or not the original values should be used when the form is reset. If *[js:true]*, the form will be populated with the original values.

page.warning: Do not use this method to reset a UX or Grid component. Use the *[link:{dialog.object}.resetForm@ux component resetform method]* and *[link:Grid object reset methods@grid component properties and methods#section_{grid.object}.resetDetailView Method]* instead.

discussion.p: This is similar to A5.form.prepare(), however, it does not create the events or attributes. If the form was prepared previously, this function will reset all “a5isdirty” attributes to “false” and set all “a5originalvalue” attributes to the current value in the control. This is a useful function to run after a form is “cleared”
If keepOldValues is true, then the controls in the form are reset to the original values when the form was originally prepared.
